title: Geography of robotics
html:
Geography of robotics

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Robotics is the branch of technology that deals with the design, construction, operation, structural disposition, manufacture and application of robots. Robotics is related to the sciences of electronics, engineering, mechanics, and software.

Contents

  • 1 United States
  • 2 Japan
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

United States[edit]

Main article: American robotics

Robots of the United States include simple household robots such as Roomba to sophisticated autonomous aircraft such as the MQ-9 Reaper that cost 18 million dollars per unit. The first industrial robot, robot company and exoskeletons as well as the first dynamically balancing, organic, and nanoscale robots originate from the United States.

Japan[edit]

Main article: Japanese robotics

Japan has a long robotics history and high reputation in the robotics area. Approximately 700,000 industrial robots were used all over the world in 1995, of which 500,000 we used only in Japan.[1]

See also[edit]

  • List of robots
  • Robotics in China
  • Robotics in Iran

References[edit]

  1. ^ "A (Social) History of Robots(and maybe some consequences of same)" (PDF). Retrieved 2010-04-05.
